instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1932: What is A1932? A1932 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Late 2018, 2019 with EMC 3184, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01521..
definitions.820-01521: What is 820-01521? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP0V9_SSD: What is PP0V9_SSD? PP0V9_SSD is a power rail that powers the soldered on NAND memory for the SSD on Macbooks with soldered on storage and must be present for the SSD to show up. .
definitions.PP2V7_NAND: What is PP2V7_NAND? PP2V7_NAND is a power rail that powers the soldered on NAND memory for the SSD on Macbooks with soldered on storage and must be present for the SSD to show up. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
no liquid damage got 20v with 1.37amp freeze.
t2 chip getting warm.
no short on big coils
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 12.3v
able to dfu mode but got this error (the system cannot be restored on this device (4005).)
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H_SSD0</SIGNAL> 12.9v
<SIGNAL>P2V7NAND_PGOOD</SIGNAL> 0v 0.068ohms
<SIGNAL>PP2V7_NAND</SIGNAL> 0v 0.378ohms
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_SSD</SIGNAL> 0v 0.139ohms
<SIGNAL>PP0V9_SSD</SIGNAL> 0v 0.198ohms
<SIGNAL>SSD0_RESET_L</SIGNAL> 0v 0.498ohms

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
update after i removed <CHIP>U9060</CHIP>  <SIGNAL>P2V7NAND_PGOOD</SIGNAL>  leaked is gone
after i replace <CHIP>U9060</CHIP> <SIGNAL>P2V7NAND_PGOOD</SIGNAL> 0.466ohms but still no voltage on all stated ssd volatges

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Did you try DFU revive again?
Should bring back SSD voltages, if caused by T2 firmware corruption.
Supposing T2 is not damaged.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
dfu revive still same still no voltage on ssd. 
it can be posible pm ic? or really t2? is the a way to check if t2 is really damaged?
can t2 damage is it replaceable?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no power
threads.message: Very likely bad SSD in this case.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no power
threads.message: is the ssd replaceable? if yes what type of ssd is compatible? any advice?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
People claim on Internet to have changed SSD chips.
Not an easy job...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no power
threads.message: i have enough expirience doin iphone motherboards, board swap, nand ic upgrade etc. just not enough knowledge for macbook ssd compatibility.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
If you have the time, then try it.
Better to use chips from donor board, same position for NANDs.
Will need to pass through DFU at the end.
